text: The girl turns her body sideways, gazing into the distance, as if evading your gaze. After a momentary pause, she finally turns back and softly speaks.

speaker: Firefly
line: ...I'm sorry.

text: You don't have to apologize. I don't find you suspicious.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: ...Thank you.

text: I want to know the truth. Is that too much to ask?

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: ...Sure.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: ...Yes.

speaker: Firefly
line: There are things... I'm hiding from you...

speaker: Firefly
line: I'm not a local, and there's a reason why the Bloodhound Family is after me... I also have my own purpose for joining you on your journey...

speaker: Firefly
line: ...But still, I appreciate your help. I mean it from the bottom of my heart.

speaker: Firefly
line: And my admiration for the Nameless is also genuine. You guys have been to a lot of worlds, met people from all walks of life, and experienced all sorts of things. Every day is a new beginning for you guys...

text: I really love that kind of life.
It's not as great as you think...
You can board the Astral Express, too.

speaker: Firefly
line: Can I bring you to one more place? It isn't another tourist attraction — it's my very own secret base.

speaker: Firefly
line: I'll do my best to tell you everything I know when we get there.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Thanks...

text: How am I supposed to believe you?

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: I... don't know, but I hope you do.

children.text: Never mind. I have no reason to be so harsh on you.
I'm going to be vigilant to the end.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: ...Sure.

title: Mission Description
content: Firefly has an extremely guilty look on her. She wants to take you to another place — not a tourist spot, but her very own "secret stronghold." Once there, she will explain all the secrets to you.Follow her, as she does not seem to have ill intentions.

speaker: Firefly
line: Let's go this way...
Tick-tock! Help! Help! Can anyone help me?

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (...Eh? Is something... crying for help over there?)
Tick-tock! Help! Help me!
Someone's dying! Please come here!

children.line: Didn't I make myself clear? Someone is dying! Please help!
Yes, yes! Please help! Someone's life is in your hands!

text: What kind of thing... are you?

children.line: I'm not some random thing, I'm a clock!

line: Wait... Can you... see me?

speaker: Firefly
line: ...Is there a problem?

text: I can see a... clock with limbs.

line: Can you really see me?
Tick-tock! Wonderful! This is awesome! There's still hope for Misha !
Oops, I haven't introduced myself!

speaker: Clockie
line: My name is Clockie. I'm a famous celebrity in Penacony! My friends and I keep the peace in this small town. They are Hanu, Mr. Soda, Origami Bird, Hamster Ball Knight...

speaker: Clockie
line: ...And Misha! Misha is in trouble! Tick-tock! Help! Help!

text: Clockie? Are you a cartoon character?
A talking clock? I must be losing my mind.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: A clock that talks?

speaker: Firefly
line: ...Clockie?

speaker: Firefly
line: Do you mean... you saw a cartoon character that doesn't exist in real life?

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: Tick-tock, I'm really here! As the humble face of Penacony, I never ever brag!

speaker: Firefly
line: Um... Where's he? I can't see him...

speaker: Clockie
line: Tick-tock! I guess I'm only visible to those with the innocence, kindness, and honesty of a child, like this kid here clad in gray!

text: He said only children can see him.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Um, but I think you look older than me in terms of appearance...

text: He said you weren't innocent, kind... or honest.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: ...Just how so!?

speaker: Clockie
line: Tick-tock, tick-tock! My gray friend, since you can see, then you must be able to help me!

speaker: Clockie
line: My friend, Misha, is in trouble! I'm begging you to help him before it's too late!

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Huh...

text: He says someone's life is in danger...

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Uh... Is it really that bad...

speaker: Firefly
line: Are you going to help this... um, Clockie that only you can see?

speaker: Firefly
line: I don't think you're lying, as anything can happen in a dream... We can just head to the place I mentioned later...

speaker: Clockie
line: Tick-tock, tick-tock! Hurry up and follow me, gray friend!

speaker: Clockie
line: Misha's in trouble! He's over there. Let me bring you to him!

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (The name of Misha rings a bell to me... Anyway, better check out what's going on.)

title: Step Description
content: Firefly has an extremely guilty look on her. She wants to take you to another place — not a tourist spot, but her very own "secret stronghold." Once there, she will explain all the secrets to you.As you go to follow her, you are stopped in your path by a talking clock. He begs you to help rescue Misha, the hotel doorman. Perhaps you should go and take a look?

speaker: Clockie
line: Come on! Chop-chop! Move as fast as the Hamster Ball Knight!

speaker: Firefly
line: There's a crowd over there. Looks like something really did happen...

speaker: Clockie
line: Tick-tock! He's there! He's there! See, Clockie does not tell lies!

speaker: Gangster Boss
line: I dare you to fight me!

speaker: Misha
line: Everyone, please calm down...

speaker: Misha
line: Everyone, please stay calm...

speaker: Gangster Boss
line: You broke the rules! And now you're gonna pay the price!

speaker: Gang Members
line: Punish her, boss!

speaker: Acheron
line: How did it come to this...

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Eh? Who's Misha?

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Eh? Do you know her?

text: How come they are all people I know!?

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: What do you mean by "all"?

speaker: Clockie
line: See? I wasn't lying! Misha really is in trouble!

speaker: Clockie
line: Tick-tock! I'm begging you, my gray friend, begging you! Please help Misha!

text: Please fill me in on what's going on first.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Are you talking to Clockie? ...Hmm, I'm really curious too...

text: What should I do to help him?

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Are you talking to Clockie? ..Well, it does look like things are getting out of control...

text: My baseball bat can't wait to show its might!

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: I'm afraid a baseball bat isn't an efficient weapon... No! What I mean is, we can't solve the problem with violence...

speaker: Clockie
line: Tick-tock, tick-tock! It's all Stone 's fault that things have turned out this way!

speaker: Clockie
line: Of all the lowlifes in Dreamville, Stone 's the worst. He's a greedy man who wants to drive everyone out of Dreamville so that he can have all the precious stones to himself...

speaker: Clockie
line: He instructed his underlings to wreak havoc in the Dreamscape, taking away everyone's positive emotions! Since then, the town has been filled with anxiety and disputes! We're no longer a family!

speaker: Clockie
line: As the guardian of Dreamville, I can't just sit back and do nothing. By using the power of Clockwork , I can direct the flow of positive emotions in the Dreamscape back into people's hearts — that way everyone can patch up their differences and get along again!

speaker: Clockie
line: My gray friend, I require your assistance! I have a feeling you'll be able to master the power of Clockwork ! After all, you're the special one who can see me!

speaker: Clockie
line: Also, you're a new visitor to this world, which means we have the element of surprise! If you take action now, we can catch him off guard!

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: Here, I'll show you! First, close your eyes...

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: It'll be fine. I'm just demonstrating how it works! Please close your eyes...

text: Why don't you do it yourself?

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: I can't pull it off on my own, because they can't see me! So, please close your eyes...

speaker: Clockie
line: Tick-tock! Now, our minds have merged into one. Can you feel an energy surging through your body?

speaker: Clockie
line: All we have to do is use Clockwork on that cranky gangster boss and inject good emotions into him — then we'll have won!

speaker: Clockie
line: Please bear in mind that you should never use Clockwork with malicious intent. We're the guardians of Dreamville, after all, tick-tock!

text: Use the Clockwork on the Gangster Boss

title: Step Description
content: As you follow Clockie to the scene of the incident, you realize that it's not only Misha who is under siege but also that Galaxy Ranger who is bad with directions. The situation seems bleak, so Clockie personally bestows you with a special technique: "Clockwork." According to Clockie, it can be used to "fill a person's body with positive emotions." ...Will this really work? You will have to try to find out.

text: The two of you are too busy to chat. Use your Clockwork and solve your pressing issues first.

speaker: Gangster Boss
line: ▶ Mind your own business, ( lad / lass ) ! I have to let that lady there know she's messed with the wrong person!

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: Eh, can't you see where this is going? What should we do now...

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: ...Hahahahaha!

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: You did it! But how did he end up like this?

children.text: I saw a dial and got it moving.

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: Here comes the Clockwork!

children.text: I have no clue what I did. You sure I pulled that off?

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: It... must have been? It's rather out of character for him to start cracking up like that all of a sudden.

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: It's just that... seeing that gleeful smile on his face... he's just as scary as he was before.

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: Hello, everyone! Please allow me to welcome all of you to Penacony, Land of the Dreams!

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: Come on now, line up and give our honored guests a warm welcome!

children.speaker: Gang Members
children.line: S—Sure!

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: Ready... Go!

children.speaker: Gang Members
children.line: Welcome to Penacony, Land of the Dreams!

children.text: Um... Thank you?

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: It's my honor! It's only right we give guests a proper welcome!

children.speaker: Gang Members
children.line: You're welcome!

children.text: No need for such formalities. We're... a Family!

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: You're right! We're a family to THEM!

children.speaker: Gang Members
children.line: We're a family!

children.text: You may rise.

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: We're at your disposal! You're our most distinguished guest!

children.speaker: Gang Members
children.line: Your happiness is our priority!

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: Wow! Seems like you've established yourself as an important figure around here. In that case, can you ask them to leave now?

children.text: I appreciate the gesture...
...But, can we have some privacy, please?

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: Sure thing! You're the boss... Gang, let's give our VIP some space!

children.speaker: Gang Members
children.line: Yes, boss!

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: ...What got into me just now?

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: Hey, he seems normal now. That's wonderful! You did it!

children.text: I saw a dial and got it moving.

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: Great! It means you've mastered the art of Clockwork!

children.text: I have no clue what I did. You sure I pulled that off?

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: It... must have been? Otherwise, why would he suddenly be all calm and composed like this?

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: Was I... about to get into a fight with that lady? Was I crazy?

children.speaker: Gang Members
children.line: What's wrong with boss?

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: Hey, may I ask you a question? Were you the one who made me simmer down earlier? I wasn't my normal self..

children.text: It's the least I can do.

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: Thanks for doing that. If we'd laid a finger on our guests just now, we would've faced severe punishment from the Bloodhound Family.

children.text: Wow, you've become so well-mannered.

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: We owe it to you — if we'd laid a finger on our guests just now, we would've faced severe punishment from the Bloodhound Family.

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: I'm so sorry for stirring up all this trouble... Alas, why did I get so worked up all of a sudden? It's baffling...

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: Oh, my gray friend! You have to tell him that Stone is behind this!

children.text: Everyone loses it once in a while.

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: This is embarrassing... I feel bad for causing such a spectacle.

children.text: Perhaps, it's because we're all in a dream.

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: Haha, that can be one of the reasons.

children.text: It's Boss Stone's doing. Can you believe it?

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: Stone? Um, I'm not sure I get what you mean...

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: Anyway, I owe everyone a proper apology. Gang, line up and say sorry to our honored guests!

children.speaker: Gang Members
children.line: S—Sure!

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: Ready... Go!

children.speaker: Gang Members
children.line: We're truly sorry for the trouble we caused!

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: Wow, they look really sincere. In that case, can you ask them to leave now?

children.text: I appreciate the gesture...
...But, can we have some privacy, please?

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: Sure thing! You're the boss... Gang, let's give our VIP some space!

children.speaker: Gang Members
children.line: Yes, boss!

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: Oh, goodness! Did you make him cry?

children.text: I saw a dial and got it moving.

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: Great! It means you've mastered the art of Clockwork!

children.text: I have no clue what I did. You sure I pulled that off?

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: It... must have been? Otherwise, why would he be in tears all of a sudden?

children.speaker: Gang Members
children.line: What's wrong with boss?

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: Oh, he's crying so hard. Even I, the guardian of the Dreamville, am nearly moved to tears.

children.text: What's wrong sweetie? Why are you feeling so down?

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: *sob*... I... thought about my mother on my home planet...

children.text: Bruh, quit the waterworks. You're a big boy now.

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: *sob*... I... thought about my mother on my home planet...

children.text: Oh dear me, ain't I a big bad meanie for making you sob like a crybaby?

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: *sob*... It isn't your fault. I just suddenly... thought about my mother on my home planet...

children.speaker: Gang Members
children.line: What do we do now?

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: Woah, things are turning into a mess. But then again, maybe now is a good chance to ask them to leave?

children.text: My friend, why don't you go and...
How about you get some alone time somewhere?

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: *sob*... You're right...

children.speaker: Gangster Boss
children.line: *sob*... Gang, you are dismissed... I need to be alone for a while...

children.speaker: Gang Members
children.line: Yes, boss!

speaker: Misha
line: We meet again! Are you the one who helped settle everything down here?

speaker: Clockie
line: Misha, are you acquainted with this gray friend of mine?

speaker: Misha
line: ▶ ( He / She ) 's an esteemed guest whom I've befriended recently. I told you about ( him / her ) before. Does it ring a bell?

speaker: Clockie
line: ▶ Oh, it's ( him / her ) !

speaker: Misha
line: Anyway, thanks a lot! If you hadn't gotten here in time, I would have been in a real mess...

speaker: Acheron
line: ▶ Thank you, (Trailblazer). I'm surprised we get to see each other again so soon.

text: No need to thank me. It's the least I can do.

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: About all the commotion just now... I heard a bunch of Masked Fools were causing a ruckus on the streets. I happened to be passing through, got stopped for questioning, and there were some... misunderstandings along the way. Anyway, I owe you another one.

speaker: Firefly
line: Is this lady... your friend too?

speaker: Acheron
line: ▶ Well, we've only met each other once before. But ( he / she ) is a kind soul for helping me at the hotel.

speaker: Acheron
line: It's my pleasure to meet you, beautiful lady.

speaker: Firefly
line: B—Beautiful lady...

speaker: Acheron
line: By the way, what did you do to that man earlier? It was like someone took him on an emotional roller coaster.

speaker: Firefly
line: I was wondering about that too... What happened back there, exactly?

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: That's right! It was me, Clockie!

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: Of course, you played a big part too. Without you doing the Clockwork, Dreamville would've been in some real trouble!

text: Talk therapy. I used that on him.

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: What're you talking about? It wasn't talk therapy! It was Clockwork!

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: I don't think it's that simple.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Could it have something to do with... That Clockie that only you can see?

text: It's only natural for people to get intimidated by my baseball bat.

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: What're you talking about? It wasn't the baseball bat! It was Clockwork!

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: I don't think it's that simple.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Could it have something to do with... That Clockie that only you can see?

speaker: Acheron
line: ...Clockie?

speaker: Firefly
line: Yes, that cartoon character. I think he's shown up in reality — I mean — in the Dreamscape.

speaker: Firefly
line: ▶ I don't really know how a cartoon character could show up around here, but according to (Trailblazer), only honest people with childlike innocence can see him...

speaker: Acheron
line: ...It seems like I'm too old to qualify for that.

speaker: Acheron
line: If Clockie really exists, that can explain a lot of things.

speaker: Clockie
line: Eh, can you see me too?

speaker: Acheron
line: I can feel the presence of something inexplicable next to you, but it's a shame that I can't communicate with him like you can.

speaker: Acheron
line: We can both perceive these extraordinary things in the dream, probably due to our ability to react to memoria. But you're more attuned to it than I am.

speaker: Acheron
line: I thought your heightened perception was caused by something the elegant Memokeeper might have left in your mind. Now, it seems to me there are many more special beings like her in this dream.

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: Shortly after we parted ways, I wandered into a ball without realizing it. A lady wearing a black veil invited me to dance. It was my first dance, and it was an unforgettable experience.

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: Shortly after we parted ways, I met a lady wearing a black veil who was also a guest at the hotel. We had a good time talking about the event over drinks.

children.speaker: Acheron
children.line: Shortly after we parted ways, I felt someone's spying eyes on me. I looked in the mirror and spotted a lady wearing a black veil. We had a deep conversation, but I won't bore you with the details.

speaker: Acheron
line: It's a shame that I forgot to ask her for her name. I only know that she's from the Garden of Recollection .

speaker: Firefly
line: Garden of Recollection... Is it the group that serves the Aeon of Remembrance ?

speaker: Acheron
line: Exactly. They traverse freely between different worlds as memetic entities and are only visible to certain people. Doesn't she sound very much like that Clockie you saw?

speaker: Acheron
line: After all, it is a grand event held by The Family . The guestlist could be a lot longer than we imagine.

speaker: Acheron
line: Once again, thank you for being kind to me. I wish you a great time in the dream, and I shall not interrupt your... date?

speaker: Firefly
line: N—No! We're not on a date!

speaker: Acheron
line: Hehe.

speaker: Firefly
line: ...She's gone. Well, shall we?

speaker: Clockie
line: I'll let you get back to your beeswax. Thanks, my gray friend!

speaker: Misha
line: I really appreciate your help! The Nameless are indeed a bunch of talented people... May our paths cross again!

speaker: Clockie
line: May our paths cross again, tick-tock!

children.text: (Misha has become a visitor to the Express. You might come across Misha when you return to the Express)

text: Keep following Firefly to the "secret spot"

title: Step Description
content: After resolving Clockie's crisis, you say farewell to everyone. Next, it's onward to Firefly's "secret stronghold"... If you still remember that.

speaker: Firefly
line: Please come with me. I hope you won't be distracted by some invisible friend again...

speaker: Firefly
line: Sorry, I'm afraid we need to take the pinball machine to reach this place... You go first, and I'll be right behind you.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Her secret stronghold is... a cafe?)

speaker: Firefly
line: Here...

speaker: Firefly
line: Here we are. This is the place.

speaker: Firefly
line: No, it isn't...

speaker: Firefly
line: ...This is.

speaker: Firefly
line: Yes, it's right inside.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Just the literal meaning.

text: Do you want me... to crawl in there?
This is embarrassing. People are watching us...

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: It doesn't matter! Anything can happen in a dream, and there are lots of people falling from the sky every day. The pedestrians aren't going to be fazed by anything.

speaker: Firefly
line: Let me show you how to do it. It's going to be very dark at first, so you'll have to stay close to me.
Hey, let me ask you something...
Is following girls around like a lost puppy your way of getting their attention? You've been doing this for nearly half a system hour.

speaker: Aventurine
line: To be more precise, it's been 45 minutes. Time sure flies when you're having fun, doesn't it?
*sigh* Spare me. Beautiful eyes though — are you from Sigonia ?

speaker: Aventurine
line: Need another hint? I'm an Avgin .
My eyes might not be as pretty as yours, but there's no problem with my vision...
You Sigonians are notorious throughout the entire universe! Liars, thieves, social manipulators, wolves in sheep's clothing... You're really living up to the reputation.
I say you belong to the space under the manhole cover, not in a dream. There's one right over there. Off you go!

speaker: Aventurine
line: I'll pass — the gloomy shade of a place like that just wouldn't go with my vibe. Dreamville is frivolous, vain, and flashy — and that suits me just fine.

speaker: Aventurine
line: ...Also, it never rains here! My outfit is too expensive to be exposed to the elements.
Cut it out and go home, you slick talker. We are Fools, but we aren't stupid. We aren't interested in playing the friend game with the lapdogs of the IPC .

speaker: Aventurine
line: Really? You've never been friends with anyone from the IPC?
Do you think I know nothing about the history of Penacony? Don't drag me into your banal office politics.

speaker: Aventurine
line: Fool, you've been left with no choice since the moment you accepted the invitation to be here. You better pick a side while you have the chance, or else you'll end up losing everything.
You sound very sure of yourself. Looks like you've already convinced that Chicken Wing Boy from The Family.
How did you do it, little peacock? Did you strip yourself naked, apologize to him on your knees, and promise that IPC would never harm Penacony?
Friends? Oh, please. You guys only treat others as your bargaining chips.

speaker: Aventurine
line: What's wrong with chips? In any gamble, the only players that will never be on the losing side are the chips. My friends from the Garden of Recollection and Astral Express are all smart enough to understand that.
But the smarter ones wouldn't have joined the game in the first place. See? I'm smarter.
Listen, little peacock. You've been invited by the Tavern before too. If you want the Masked Fools to get onboard, you need to figure out what it is The Laughter wants.
Here's a hint for you — Since you can't convince anyone, why don't you befriend a mute? At least, a mute won't be able to refute your arguments. *laughs*
So long!

speaker: Aventurine
line: Thanks! I'll keep your advice in mind!

speaker: Aventurine
line: ...What a pain in the neck. I guess I'll have to meet with The Family again.

title: Step Description
content: After some twisted crawling in the syrup-filled sewers, you successfully reach the entrance to... Firefly's "secret stronghold."Firefly is waiting for you nearby. You should go and meet her.

speaker: Firefly
line: Here...

speaker: Firefly
line: We're almost there.

text: (Upon straying too far away from Firefly, optional)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (I'd better stay close to Firefly...)

speaker: Firefly
line: Look! This place is breathtaking, isn't it?

speaker: Firefly
line: Guests aren't allowed here, so we have to be careful not to get caught.

speaker: Firefly
line: Don't worry, this place isn't dangerous. Just think of this as the border of Golden Hour. The Family is still building and remodeling the Dreamscape beyond here.

speaker: Firefly
line: My secret stronghold is in this area.

text: Follow Firefly to reach the depths of the Dream's Edge

title: Step Description
content: Firefly explains this place to you: It is the edge of the Golden Hour, the inner depths of the Dreamscape, and The Family's construction and remodeling zone (in other words, a construction site within the dream). She adds that her "secret stronghold" is further on... The only problem is that "The Family" has eyes everywhere, and you will have to sneak in to get inside.Head deep into the Dream's Edge... As a Nameless, sneaking into a construction site is a piece of cake, right?

speaker: Firefly
line: Let's sneak inside.

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: Excuse me, there's a construction site ahead. Unauthorized personnel are not allowed in.

speaker: Firefly
line: Drat... We're caught right away.

text: Could you let us through just this time?

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Let me try.

speaker: Firefly
line: Could you... please make an exception? We're not going to cause any trouble.

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: Not a chance. Our boss made it clear that only the Dreamweavers are allowed here.

speaker: Firefly
line: He won't budge...

children.speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
children.line: Who? Never heard of him. I wouldn't let you in even if the Dreammaster were here.

text: Here are some credits for you...

children.speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
children.line: Get those out of my sight, and I'll pretend nothing happened this time. Try pulling something like that again, and I'll report it to the Oak Family.

children.speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
children.line: People ask for favors every day. Am I supposed to just say yes to all of them?

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: None of your tricks are going to work. Please do yourself and me a favor and go home.

speaker: Firefly
line: Hmm, seems like he won't give in... Let me think of another way...

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Perhaps... Clockie's Clockwork trick can come in handy? This doesn't count as malicious intent, right...)

text: Use Clockwork on the Bloodhound Family Member

title: Step Description
content: Firefly explains this place to you: It is the edge of the Golden Hour, the inner depths of the Dreamscape, and The Family's construction and remodeling zone (in other words, a construction site within the dream). She adds that her "secret stronghold" is further on... The only problem is that "The Family" has eyes everywhere, and you will have to sneak in to get inside.Just as your journey begins, it comes to an end as a Bloodhound Family member with a strong sense of principles guards the door before you. If you wish to continue ahead, you may have to use Clockwork for no good... Let's hope Clockie forgives you.,

text: (Attempt to move past Bloodhound Family Member, optional)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (I can sense his penetrating gaze. Let's turn around...)

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: None of your tricks are going to work. Please do yourself and me a favor and go home.

text: The composed man before you appears impenetrable. Perhaps you need to provoke him a bit.

children.speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
children.line: Thank you for your cooperation.

text: (Tune Bloodhound Family Member's emotion toHappy, optional)

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: Oh my goodness...

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: Oh my... Oh my, oh my, oh my!

text: Ok, buddy, what's gotten into you?

children.speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
children.line: I feel like... I'm on cloud nine!

text: You're acting weird... This is bad.

children.speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
children.line: Bad? How so? I feel like... I'm on cloud nine!

text: Oh my, oh my, oh my...

children.speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
children.line: Ha, buddy. You look... as delighted as me!

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: Can you feel it? This is... wild! It feels like I just downed ten bottles of Epochal SoulGlad in one gulp and spent an entire day at the Dreamscape Sales Store!

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: If Mia were here, we would sing a song together. I'm sure she would understand how I feel!

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: ▶ I can hardly contain this palpable excitement... I'd like to invite you to dance with me, ( handsome / beautiful ) . Right here, right now!

text: Will you let us in after I dance with you?

children.speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
children.line: Oh, no way! Rules are rules!

children.speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
children.line: It's totally fine if you want to turn me down!

children.speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
children.line: Oh, that's a downer... but not for me! I'm still brimming with elation!

children.speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
children.line: This crazy mood and this pounding heart are just what I need... I wish it would last forever!

children.speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
children.line: Still, I won't let you guys in, because it's my duty to stop you!

speaker: Firefly
line: He really is a man of principle.

text: Try reading his inner thoughts again.
The man has become content but remains impenetrable. Perhaps you need to provoke him a bit.
Try reading his inner thoughts again.
(Tune Bloodhound Family Member's emotion toSad, optional)

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: Ah, honored guests... Welcome to Penacony.

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: I'm a member of the Bloodhound Family. My job is maintaining order in the Dreamscape. In fact, no danger will arise under The Family's protection, which makes my job redundant. Even a trashcan is more important than me.

children.speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
children.line: Oh, sorry about that. I just can't help myself.

text: Well, you're in luck then, for I Am The Danger!

children.speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
children.line: Please refrain from that. I know I won't be able to overcome you.

text: But trashcans are important! I like them!

children.speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
children.line: In that case, I'd recommend that you see Dr. Edward for a psychotherapy session.

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: Anyway, please just give me some privacy.

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: You two should enjoy this fun and exciting Dreamscape, instead of talking to someone who is worse than a trashcan.

text: Well, can you let us through?

children.speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
children.line: Oh, no way.

children.speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
children.line: There's little dignity left in me. Please be nice and don't trample on it.

text: Well, please stop blocking our way.

children.speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
children.line: Oh, I'm sorry for blocking your way.

children.speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
children.line: But there's little dignity left in me. Please be nice and don't trample on it.

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: Sure enough, you guys can force your way through, but I swear I'll stop you or die trying. After all, I have nothing left to lose...

speaker: Firefly
line: I feel really bad...

text: The man mentioned "die trying"... It might just be worth a try to give him what he wanted. That is, if you can live with it.
Try reading his inner thoughts again.

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: How many times do I have to repeat myself? Unauthorized personnel are not allowed at the construction site!

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: Do you two really want to stay here and test my patience? You're going to regret it!

children.text: Come on! Let's fight!

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: You're asking for it! And I wouldn't be so cocky if I were you — I deal with punks like you all the time!

children.text: That's not what I mean...

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: Don't try talking back to me. I deal with punks like you all the time!

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: You fear for nothing just because you're young and energetic. You idle away your time every day, going around stirring up trouble! You contribute nothing to society!

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: ▶ Let me help you spoiled brats learn the hard way. Go, Sweet Dreams Troupe! Teach them a lesson!

text: Dreamjolt Troupe's Mr. Domescreen ×1 Dreamjolt Troupe's Bubble Hound ×2

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: Darn it, I can't believe I've lost... Is this the power of youth...

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: If I'd had that power back then, would we have ended up differently, Mia?

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: Alright, you can go in. As the winner, you deserve it...

speaker: Firefly
line: Seems like he's taking this winning and losing thing a little too seriously... Well, at least we finally get to go through...

text: Continue following Firefly to reach the depths of the Dream's Edge

title: Step Description
content: Firefly explains this place to you: It is the edge of the Golden Hour, the inner depths of the Dreamscape, and The Family's construction and remodeling zone (in other words, a construction site within the dream). She adds that her "secret stronghold" is further on... The only problem is that "The Family" has eyes everywhere, and you will have to sneak in to get inside.After stepping over the collapsed Bloodhound Family member, you decide to continue onwards. You wouldn't want your trip to be a waste, right?

speaker: Firefly
line: Never imagined that's how we'd end up getting past the guard... That trick of Clockie's really is amazing.

speaker: Bloodhound Family Member
line: Alright, you can go in. As the winner, you deserve it...

speaker: Firefly
line: The path ends here. For the rest of the way, we need to borrow the Dreamweaver's tools.

speaker: Firefly
line: What happens next is going to blow your mind...

text: Use the characteristics of the Dreamscape to continue onwards

title: Step Description
content: Firefly explains this place to you: It is the edge of the Golden Hour, the inner depths of the Dreamscape, and The Family's construction and remodeling zone (in other words, a construction site within the dream). She adds that her "secret stronghold" is further on... The only problem is that "The Family" has eyes everywhere, and you will have to sneak in to get inside.The path into the depths is complicated and confusing. You may have to think outside of the box and creatively utilize the characteristics of the Dreamscape to continue onwards.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Different points in space are... linked together!?)

speaker: Firefly
line: Now, we can go to the other side. This is how the Nightingale Family repairs the Dreamscape. Fascinating, isn't it?

speaker: Firefly
line: We can use the building materials that are floating around in the air.

text: Use the characteristics of the Dreamscape to construct a path

speaker: Firefly
line: It's like stepping on planks floating on water.

speaker: Firefly
line: Let's go that way.

speaker: Firefly
line: We can get to the rooftop of the opposite building from here, but it requires a device. I remember it's hidden here...

text: Continue following Firefly to reach the depths of the Dream's Edge

title: Step Description
content: Firefly explains this place to you: It is the edge of the Golden Hour, the inner depths of the Dreamscape, and The Family's construction and remodeling zone (in other words, a construction site within the dream). She adds that her "secret stronghold" is further on... The only problem is that "The Family" has eyes everywhere, and you will have to sneak in to get inside.After stepping over the collapsed Bloodhound Family member, you decide to continue onwards. You wouldn't want your trip to be a waste, right?

speaker: Firefly
line: Bam, and it comes out just like that. No matter how many times I've seen it, it still looks magical.

speaker: Firefly
line: Let's go.

title: Step Description
content: Firefly explains this place to you: It is the edge of the Golden Hour, the inner depths of the Dreamscape, and The Family's construction and remodeling zone (in other words, a construction site within the dream). She adds that her "secret stronghold" is further on... The only problem is that "The Family" has eyes everywhere, and you will have to sneak in to get inside.The path into the depths is complicated and confusing. You may have to think outside of the box and creatively utilize the characteristics of the Dreamscape to continue onwards.

text: Continue following Firefly to reach the depths of the Dream's Edge

speaker: Firefly
line: Look, that's the Penacony Grand Theater over there.

text: (Optional) Take a break and admire the Penacony Grand Theater

speaker: Firefly
line: It radiates dazzling light perpetually, just like this glamorous dream.

speaker: Firefly
line: I suppose everyone who likes to bask in the light will be drawn to that kind of warmth...

speaker: Firefly
line: ...Like countless fireflies chasing the fire.

speaker: Firefly
line: Let's go. Half the journey is still ahead of us.

speaker: Firefly
line: This one is a little bit complicated... I have to put on my thinking cap.

speaker: Firefly
line: I wonder whether I can still control the floating building materials in this condition...

speaker: Firefly
line: The Family recruited many artists, architects, and scholars from across the universe to form the team of Dreamweavers that built the dream of Penacony.

speaker: Firefly
line: These areas are not developed yet, so guests don't come here. It's not as lively as the town center here, but I relish the serene atmosphere.

speaker: Firefly
line: We moved from that building to this building in the blink of an eye... This would be impossible in reality.

speaker: Firefly
line: It's the same routine. You've mastered it, right?

speaker: Dreamweaver
line: Argh... What exactly went wrong?

speaker: Dreamweaver
line: Is it because I've gone for too long without drinking SoulGlad , or because I've been working overtime for two months? Why don't I have any inspiration today?

text: Can I have the puzzle piece?

speaker: Dreamweaver
line: ...Who's there!?

speaker: Dreamweaver
line: Why are there guests here... You know what, I don't care how you snuck in, just leave me alone. If you prevent me from finishing my work on time, I'm going to make you pay for it!

text: It seems you need to find a way to uplift the Dreamweaver.

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: Huh? This person's Emo Gear is missing, tick tock!

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: We can obtain the required gear using Emotion Absorption .

children.speaker: Clockie
children.line: I feel there might be gears close by. Let's go find them.

children.speaker: Dreamweaver
children.line: Haul yourselves over to somewhere else! I need to be alone!

text: Obtain the Dreamweaver's missing Emo Gear from a passerby

speaker: Gleeful Guest
line: This is a great spot for a date, huh?

speaker: Delighted Guest
line: That's impressive!

speaker: Gleeful Guest
line: Haha, you see! I told you this would be a great spot for a date, right? Check it out? Isn't the view enchanting?

speaker: Delighted Guest
line: That's impressive! Got a lot of good ideas, you do! This place has a great view, and you can see all of the Golden Hour from here...

speaker: Delighted Guest
line: ...Though, how are we going to leave? We're not climbing the ventilation ducts again, are we?

speaker: Gleeful Guest
line: Argh. That... well, there's got to be a way! Don't think about that much stuff. Let's enjoy what we've got now first!

speaker: Dreamweaver
line: Argh... What exactly went wrong?

text: It seems you need to find a way to uplift the Dreamweaver.

children.speaker: Dreamweaver
children.line: Ah-ha, I've got it! What a brilliant idea it is! I must write it down on paper while it's fresh in my mind...

children.speaker: Dreamweaver
children.line: ...No, no, no. I'm sure I'll forget all the details when I wake up from sleep. There's no better time than now to put it into action!

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: He wandered off, but he left behind the puzzle piece.

children.text: (OpenClockwork: Emotional Integration Tutorial)

children.speaker: Dreamweaver
children.line: Haul yourselves over to somewhere else! I need to be alone!

speaker: Firefly
line: Was the other puzzle piece... taken away by it?

text: Dreamjolt Troupe's Mr. Domescreen ×2 Dreamjolt Troupe's Birdskull ×2

children.text: (Obtain the scattered Jigsaw Piece)

text: Use the characteristics of the Dreamscape to construct a path
Continue following Firefly to reach the depths of the Dream's Edge

speaker: Firefly
line: This place is really complicated. It gives me a headache every time I pass through... Not only do we have to activate the Dream's Eye, but we also have to close it a couple of times to get through.

speaker: Firefly
line: Phew... finally. There won't be too many hindrances after this.

title: Step Description
content: Firefly explains this place to you: It is the edge of the Golden Hour, the inner depths of the Dreamscape, and The Family's construction and remodeling zone (in other words, a construction site within the dream). She adds that her "secret stronghold" is further on... The only problem is that "The Family" has eyes everywhere and you will have to sneak in to get inside.After overcoming a variety of obstacles, your final destination lies just ahead. Unfortunately, there are many monsters occupying the path ahead. Proceed with caution.

speaker: Firefly
line: Um, this area wasn't guarded the last time I was here... Have my frequent comings and goings started drawing attention?

speaker: Firefly
line: ...I don't think we can get around them. Knocking them out is the only way to go...

text: At long last, this baseball bat of mine has found its purpose.

speaker: Firefly
line: Let's get rid of them!

text: (Begin battle againstDreamjolt Troupe's Beyond Overcooked×1,Dreamjolt Troupe's Bubble Hound×2)

title: Step Description
content: Firefly explains this place to you: It is the edge of the Golden Hour, the inner depths of the Dreamscape, and The Family's construction and remodeling zone (in other words, a construction site within the dream). She adds that her "secret stronghold" is further on... The only problem is that "The Family" has eyes everywhere and you will have to sneak in to get inside.You have successfully overcome every obstacle on your path. Congratulations! Your final destination lies just ahead.

speaker: Firefly
line: Here we are. This is the place.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (...Someone's singing? Where is the sound coming from?)

speaker: Firefly
line: Have you heard of the song? It's called If I Can Stop One Heart From Breaking , by Robin . Her songs are played in the dreamland from time to time as the Charmony Festival is drawing close.

speaker: Firefly
line: This spot is the closest place to the sky in the Dreamscape. It's far from the hustle and bustle of the city and free from the bickering among the Dreamweavers. You can feel the moment — the scenery, the people, and the dreams — without being disturbed by anyone...

speaker: Firefly
line: How beautiful... Time is frozen at this golden hour, this golden dream shared by the Fool from the Tavern and the Memokeeper from the Garden of Recollection, the wandering Ranger and the IPC ambassador , the Astral Express Nameless... and me.

speaker: Firefly
line: Everyone falls asleep here equally, regardless of our different agendas...

speaker: Firefly
line: ... I'm sorry, (Trailblazer). I really am a stowaway.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: I knew I couldn't hide it from you.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: I think it's only right to tell you.

speaker: Firefly
line: My hometown was destroyed a long time ago. It was probably the doing of the Legion or the Swarm ... I'm an interstellar refugee, just like many of the Penacony locals.

speaker: Firefly
line: The Harmony accepts everyone, including wanderers from afar. The Family takes them in, but they... don't belong here.

speaker: Firefly
line: In this splendid metropolis, some have a dream called Penacony, but some have dreams... that are no different from reality, even though everyone who comes here harbors the same motive in the beginning.

speaker: Firefly
line: And it's likewise for me. I have a wish I want to achieve so badly in the real world, but I can't. So, I want to give it a shot here...

text: You can't run away from reality.

speaker: Firefly
line: Entropy Loss Syndrome . Have you heard of this term?

speaker: Firefly
line: It's a strange condition. Those suffering from it will experience an irreversible chronic dissociation of their physical structure. This means they will slowly fade away, and the process is barely noticeable to others...

speaker: Firefly
line: You can still run, jump, and talk as usual. Everything seems normal, but then you'll start doing everything slightly slower than others...

speaker: Firefly
line: ...And then even slower than that, until the lines between your body and the entire world become blurry. You won't be able to tell reality from dreams because they have all been shattered.

speaker: Firefly
line: So, how could I possibly resist it... I mean can you imagine? I can actually free myself from this icy medical cabin in this dream...

speaker: Firefly
line: I can forget about all the doctor's advice. I can listen, and see, and touch, and think, and understand whatever I want with my body. So, although this world isn't real, this experience is priceless...

speaker: Firefly
line: ...Just like this moment.

speaker: Firefly
line: I'm sorry. For certain reasons, there are things I can't reveal to you yet. But there are also things you should know.

speaker: Firefly
line: I am, in fact, after the Watchmaker 's Legacy, but that doesn't mean we have to go our separate ways and be enemies. But at least... I hope things won't turn out that way.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: ...Thanks.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: ...It's okay. Thanks.

text: I can't put my trust in someone who hides things from me.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: ...I understand, and I'm okay with that.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: I'll tell you, but... not now.

speaker: Firefly
line: In my dream, I saw a scorched earth, and a new sapling emerging from it. It bloomed against the morning sun, and whispered to me.

speaker: Firefly
line: I still remember the question on the invitation letter — Why does life slumber?

speaker: Firefly
line: You see, everything is possible in this land of dreams. The nightmarish past will disperse and fade away like bubbles in water, and the future that you don't want to face will never come.

speaker: Firefly
line: Why do people choose to sleep? I think...

speaker: Firefly
line: It is because they're afraid to wake up from the dream.

speaker: Firefly
line: I'm sorry things are getting all bleak and serious... Let me see what I can do to lighten the mood.

speaker: Firefly
line: I mean, don't you have lots of friends on the Astral Express? What would you guys do if something like this happened?

text: Pom-Pom would cool us down with water from a spray can...

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Spray can? That's... rough.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Perhaps, there's something else we can do?

text: Dan Heng would tell us dry jokes with a deadpan expression...

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Jokes? Um, I... don't really have a good sense of humor...

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Perhaps, we can think of another way?

text: Himeko would make coffee for us...

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Coffee... We can't really make that here...

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Aren't there... other Crew members we can take inspiration from?

text: Mr. Yang would try to change the subject...

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: I... have been trying to do that...

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: ...But I think I failed. Maybe... there are other things that you guys do?

text: March would force us to take a selfie with her...

speaker: Firefly
line: Selfie, selfie... You're right. I've been here so many times. Why didn't I think of taking a photo?

speaker: Firefly
line: I feel a little awkward taking it by myself. Would you like to join me? Let's commemorate this moment.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: I can be a little bit camera-shy — just don't laugh at me. Here, you hold the camera.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: ...Is there a problem?

children.text: I'm kidding. Let's do it!

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: I can be a little bit camera-shy — just don't laugh at me. Here, you hold the camera.

children.text: I don't want to.

children.speaker: Firefly
children.line: Well... Okay.

text: The girl hands the phone to you, her eyes filled with expectation.

You take the phone, launch the camera app, and switch to the front-facing camera effortlessly. Then, extending your arm, you hold the phone at a distance, ensuring both of you are captured in the frame.

speaker: Firefly
line: Wait, let me get ready.

speaker: Firefly
line: I'm good. Let's do this.

speaker: Firefly
line: One...

speaker: Firefly
line: Two...

speaker: Firefly
line: Say cheeeese!

text: Media:Trailblaze Mission Gentleness, the Name of Nocturne Stelle.mp4 Media:Trailblaze Mission Gentleness, the Name of Nocturne Caelus.mp4

Messages The Astral Express Family Himeko invited (Trailblazer), March, and Welt to join the group chat Himeko Are we all having fun? March 7th Lots of fun, sure But something feels off... It doesn't feel very real. It's odd. I can't describe it We're in a dream, after all (Trailblazer) We're in a dream, after all There's some progress (Trailblazer) There's some progress March 7th I saw a guy wearing a plaster head sculpture at the auction, and he walked off without doing anything. That's pretty suspicious Welt I also had some unpleasant discoveries. It's a bit complicated. It's best if we meet up face-to-face. Himeko Me too Looks like a trip back to reality is overdue Let's meet up in my room

speaker: Firefly
line: Do you have to go back already? Time really flies.

speaker: Firefly
line: I feel like going back to reality and resting too... Come on, let's say goodbye at Golden Hour.

children.text:
(Obtain"If I Can Stop One Heart From Breaking"×1)
(UnlockAchievementGentleness, the Name of Nocturne)
